aws::graph::propositions: # Pilot Information and Flight Planning Details
The pilot held a Private certificate.
The pilot had Airplane Rating for Single-engine land.
The pilot had Airplane Rating for Multi-engine land.
The pilot occupied the Rear seat.
The pilot had Helicopter rating.
The pilot used 4-point restraint.
The pilot had Instrument Rating for Airplane.
No second pilot was present.
The pilot had no Instructor Rating.
No toxicology was performed on the pilot.
The pilot held Class 3 Medical Certification without waivers/limitations.
The pilot's last FAA Medical Exam was on February 18, 2013.
The pilot was not an Occupational Pilot.
The pilot's last Flight Review or Equivalent was on May 6, 2013.
The pilot had 3868 total flight hours across all aircraft.
The pilot had 8 hours total in this make and model.
The pilot had 3753 hours as Pilot In Command across all aircraft.
The pilot had 55 flight hours in the last 90 days across all aircraft.
The pilot had 28 flight hours in the last 30 days across all aircraft.
The pilot had 5 flight hours in the last 24 hours across all aircraft.
The pilot thought it would be prudent and more accurate to use the carbureted engine chart for planning purposes.
The Pilot's Operating Handbook (POH) found in the airplane was non-specific about whether the engine was carbureted or fuel-injected.
The power setting chart used by the pilot was for the "360hp M14P" engine.
The power setting chart did not specifically state it was for fuel-injected engines.
The fuel burn rates in the power setting chart were lower than those listed in the POH recovered from the airplane.
Investigation fuel consumption calculations based on those rates indicated a trip fuel consumption of 44.4 gallons.
The pilot's calculated flight planning value was 44.8 gallons.
Jim Kimball Enterprises representative stated the individual named on the POH cover was "one of the most experienced Model 12 pilots and mechanics on the planet."
The Jim Kimball Enterprises representative stated the individual may have created the POH for a previous owner of the airplane.
The Jim Kimball Enterprises representative was not familiar with the document.

text:
# Pilot Information

## Pilot Information

| Certificate: | Private |
| --- | --- |
| Airplane Rating(s): | Single-engine land; Multi-engine land |
| Seat Occupied: | Rear |
| Other Aircraft Rating(s): | Helicopter |
| Restraint Used: | 4-point |
| Instrument Rating(s): | Airplane |
| Second Pilot Present: | No |
| Instructor Rating(s): | None |
| Toxicology Performed: | No |
| Medical Certification: | Class 3 Without waivers/limitations |
| Last FAA Medical Exam: | February 18, 2013 |
| Occupational Pilot: | No |
| Last Flight Review or Equivalent: | May 6, 2013 |
| Flight Time: | 3868 hours (Total, all aircraft), 8 hours (Total, this make and model), 3753 hours (Pilot In Command, all aircraft), 55 hours (Last 90 days, all aircraft), 28 hours (Last 30 days, all aircraft), 5 hours (Last 24 hours, all aircraft) |

The text indicates that the pilot thought it would be prudent and more accurate to use the carbureted engine chart for planning purposes, but the review of the Pilot's Operating Handbook (POH) found in the airplane indicated that it was non-specific as to whether the engine was carbureted or fuel-injected.

The review of the power setting chart the pilot used indicated that it was for the "360hp M14P" engine, and it did not specifically state that it was for fuel-injected engines. The fuel burn rates were also lower than those listed in the POH recovered from the airplane. Investigation fuel consumption calculations based on those rates indicated a trip fuel consumption of 44.4 gallons, which was close to the pilot's calculated flight planning value of 44.8 gallons.

The investigation communications with a representative of Jim Kimball Enterprises indicated that the individual whose name appeared on the cover of the POH found in the airplane was "one of the most experienced Model 12 pilots and mechanics on the planet." The representative added that this individual "may have created the POH for a previous owner of the airplane," but that the representative was "not familiar with the document."

---
